availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Jackson (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Jackson. Father of John W. Jackson, July F. Jackson, Isaac H. Jackson, and Mary C. Jackson. Married to Elizabeth Jackson. Father of Nancy A. Jackson, R. Thomas Jackson, and James D. Jackson. Farmer in Lewis County, Missouri, in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Charged with horse theft in Harrison County in November 1862. Fugitive from justice in Illinois in December 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Lewis County, District 48, p. 356B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 610.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Christian County, Township 14, p. 219A.
